content: When viewing an image in its fullscreen big view on web, there's grey around the image to fill in the screen. On Signal, Messenger, Slack, and Discord, I'm used to being able to click on that grey to close the image. Intuitively this feels like "clicking on the background to return to what's behind the image". This is much easier than moving my mouse to the "x". Is this something on our radar to add to image viewing on Zulip?

Hm! I agree that making the target area to close bigger would be good.

I think we may have used to have this, and it regressed, or it was partially implemented -- if you click to the left or right of the carousel on the bottom, the lightbox fades back out.
So does clicking between the title and the "Pan & Zoom" button.
Ah, yes! Interesting :thinking:
I can open an issue for it this afternoon
Yeah, this is a regression; updated the issue to tag it as a release goal.
Hey, I am interested in working on this, can I have this issue ?
Since this is a release goal, it would be great if @Austin Riba (who has been working on this area) could pick this one up.
Yes, I have been banging my head against this one practically all day.
